page.title: 04EDUCATION HIGH ERCALL
page.content: High Ercall County Primary School was erected in 1870. The old buildings still remain in use, but the school has grown in size by the addition of a new open plan infant block 15 years ago. There is a hard surfaced playground and lots of grass playing fields. In 1985 there are 106 pupils and 5 teachers including the Headmaster. School meals are cooked in the school kitchen and cost 60p a day. There is no school uniform. When children are 11 years old of age they leave the village by bus and travel to Comprehensive schools in Wellington. Children from Roden go to a school in Shrewsbury. The school has a Parent Teachers Association which raises funds for the school. By Joe Edge and Dewi Roberts
